nodes.bodyText: I think "by the adapter" and "at the infrastructure level" are potentially misleading for the telemetry case here. The adapter could have forwarded it just fine, but the northbound application for example may not have sent a disposition update in time, leading to the (initially unsettled) message to get released.

nodes.bodyText: From the client's view, it is the adapter which processes its uploaded message. The client does not know (nor need to know) if and how the adapter is forwarding the message. However, the message will also be released if one of the registry services cannot be reached by the adapter and therefore I think that it is appropriate to refer to infrastructure level in general here.
